Description: A high-level attribute for grouping attributes into templates.
A template outlining dataset metadata to use as annotations for a synapse dataset entity.
DependsOn: Component, program, project, datasetType, biospecimenType, biospecimenSubtype, diagnosis, acknowledgmentStatement, datasetDescription, ARKRelease, dataType, dataSubtype, assay, publicationSynID, associatedDataset, GitHubURL, dbGapAccession

Description: A template outlining metadata to use as annotations for scRNA-seq fastq files.
DependsOn: Component, filename, fileFormat, program, project, resourceType, nucleicAcidSource, libraryPrepMethod, libraryID, batch

Description: A template outlining metadata to use as annotations for feature barcode sequencing fastq files.
DependsOn: Component, filename, fileFormat, program, project, resourceType, nucleicAcidSource, targetPanel, targetPanelSynID, libraryID, batch

Description: A template outlining metadata to use as annotations for Publication 'file' entities.
DependsOn: Component, program, programPhase, project, associatedDataset, PMID, DOI, journal, publicationDate, year, title, publicationType

Description: A template outlining metadata to be collected for biospecimen.
DependsOn: Component, individualID, visitID, biospecimenID, biospecimenType, biospecimenSubtype

Description: A template outlining clinical and demographic metadata to be collected for V-CoRT study participants.
DependsOn: Component, program, project, individualID, diagnosis, age, ageUnits, sex, race, ethnicity, height, heightUnits, weight, weightUnits, comorbidities, vitiligoType, vitiligoSubtype, VIDA, VASI, VETI, PASI, CDASI

Description: A mock template for performing tests of GH Actions workflows
DependsOn: Component, individualID, visitID, biospecimenID, biospecimenType, biospecimenSubtype, program, project

Description: A test template for performing tests of GH Actions workflows
DependsOn: Component, individualID, visitID, biospecimenID, biospecimenType, biospecimenSubtype, program, project

Description: Standard file format name or file extension
Valid Values: csv, tsv, txt, xlsx, xls, fcs, docx, erate, rec, info, vcf, dose, tbi, fam, bim, bed, bam, h5, mtx, bai, rds, pdf, tgz, zip, fastq, parquet, geojson, tar.gz, zip

Description: Name of a file. Must be included in DependsOn for all file manifest/annotation templates.

The synID of the corresponding Synapse entity that stores metadata about the publication. This is used to differentiate publication-specific files, often consisting of level 4 processed data and expanded subject metadata, in a publication dataset that also includes raw or minimally processed files from experimental datasets. This provides an easy way to distinguish and select for the publication-specific data from which the research findings were derived. When this attribute is used to annotate a Dataset it serves as a way to directly link the Dataset entity with the publication metadata stored in Synapse.

The synID of a Dataset entity. This serves to link other Synapse entities to Dataset entities. When used to annotate a publication Dataset this attribute should include the synID for an experimental Datasets from which the publication data was derived. Multiple synID can be specified using a comma-delimited list.
Name of the funding program that supported the generation of data and associated files
Valid Values: AMP RA/SLE, AMP AIM, Community Contribution

Description: A sub-level attribute of `program` specifying a research initiative working to investigate particular hypotheses.
Valid Values: RA, SLE, AIM for RA, STAMP, LOCKIT, V-CoRT, ELLIPSS

Description: Accelerating Medicines Partnership rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus. Is a valid value for Program attribute and when selected it triggers a conditional dependency.
A label noting which AMP RA/SLE program phase generated the data.
Valid Values: I, II

Description: High-level classification of the file content
Valid Values: experimental data, metadata, figure, code

Description: File that contains machine or code generated data that is experimentally derived. Is a valid value of Resource Type and when selected triggers conditional dependencies for additional attributes.
DependsOn: individualID, visitID, biospecimenID, biospecimenType, biospecimenSubtype, diagnosis, dataType, dataSubtype, assay, dataLevel, specimenModality, platform, softwareAndVersion

Description: High-level classification of the type of data contained in the file, loosely related to the experimental method or biological entity that is being profiled. Select all that apply using a comma-delimited list, though in most cases only a single label is expected. For multimodal datasets with concomitant profiling of biospecimen include 'multimodal'.
Valid Values: transcriptomics, immune repertoire profiling, proteomics, multimodal, epigenomics, genomics, metabolomics, lipidomics, microbiome, histology, immunostaining, cytometry

Description: General classification to differentiate between omics profiling modalities. If N/A please select 'none'. Multiple selections can be provided in a comma-delimited list, however this is largely only expected in the context of Datasets and files that contain integrated experimental data spanning multiple types.
Valid Values: bulk, pseudobulk, single-cell, single-nucleus, spatial, none

Description: Level of data processing applied to file. Levels refer to pre-defined standards of processing for the given assay.

The technology used to generate the data in this file. For multimodal datasets with concomitant profiling of biospecimen select all assays that apply. e.g., the GEX files from a CITE-seq experiment should be labeled with both 'scRNASeq' and 'CITESeq'.
Valid Values: scRNASeq, CyTOF, Xenium, Olink, CITESeq, snRNASeq, snATACSeq, RNASeq, multiplexed ELISA, SNP array, imaging mass cytometry, H&E, ASAPSeq, CosMX, serial IHC, imaging mass spectrometry, LC-MS/MS, CE-MS, VDJSeq, scVDJSeq, feature barcode sequencing, SomaScan, WES, WGS, flow cytometry

Description: A scRNA-seq method that analyzes gene expression using pre-designed probes. Is a valid value of scRNASeq Method and when selected triggers conditional dependencies for additional attributes.

Name of probe set used in 10x Chromium Flex, Xenium, and Visium data. If custom modified probe set was used the probe reference should be included as metadata accompanying the experimental data files.
Valid Values: Flex Human Transcriptome Probe Set v1.1.0, Flex Human Transcriptome Probe Set v1.0.1, Visium Human Transcriptome v2, Visium Human Transcriptome v1, custom probe set

Description: This is a valid value of 10x Probe Set Reference and triggers a conditional dependency.

If custom modified probe sets were used for collecting 10x Chromium Flex scRNA-seq data, then the probe reference files should be grouped as a zip or tar archive and uploaded as metadata. This attribute links the experimental data back to the probe set archive file via a synapse ID.

The specific version (manufacturer, model, etc.) of a technology that is used to carry out a laboratory or computational experiment. Specify where applicable for experimental data files, else enter 'none'. In most cases only a single label is expected, however multiple selections can be provided in comma-delimited list where applicable e.g., for 10x Genomics fastq files please specify both the 10x instrument and the sequencing platform.
Valid Values: CyTOF XT, Helios Mass Cytometer, Hyperion, Illumina NextSeq 500, Illumina HiSeq 2500, Illumina NovaSeq 6000, Helios Mass Cytometer, Hyperion, Illumina NovaSeq X, Chromium X, Chromium iX, Chromium Xo, Chromium Controller, Visium CytAssist, Xenium, none

Description: Label assigned to experimental data files indicating whether the data contained corresponds to a single or multiple biospecimens
Valid Values: single specimen, multispecimen

Description: Unique identifier assigned to each study participant. For multi-specimen data files provide all IDs in a comma-separated list.
A unique identifier assigned to specimens collected from study participants. For multi-specimen data files provide all IDs in a comma-separated list.
A label indicating the biological material collected for experimentation and data collection. Where applicable, provide all types in a comma-separated list.
Valid Values: none, urine, stool, whole blood, serum, plasma, PBMCs, total leukocytes, kidney biopsy, synovial fluid, skin biopsy, salivary gland, saliva, skin swab, synovial tissue, suction blister cells, suction blister fluid

Description: Any file that contains curated data describing an experiment and experimental-derived data, including metadata about study subjects, biospecimens, protocols, assay reagents, marker panels, and ID mappings. Is a valid value of Resource Type that triggers conditional dependencies for additional attributes.
A label further classifying the content of metadata resource.
A file that contains a graphical representation of data such as a scatter plot, heatmap, etc. Is a valid value of Resource Type and may trigger conditional dependencies for additional attributes.
Files that contain code such as scripts, code packages, and software binary files. Is a valid value of Resource Type and may trigger conditional dependencies for additional attributes.
Ordinal ID distinguishing different patient visits
Relevant software and version used to generate the data file.
Valid Values: Cell Ranger v9.0.0, Cell Ranger v8.0.1, Cell Ranger v8.0.0, Cell Ranger v7.2.0, Cell Ranger v7.1.0, Cell Ranger v7.0.1, Cell Ranger v7.0.0, Cell Ranger v6.1.2, Cell Ranger v6.1.1, Cell Ranger v6.1.0, Cell Ranger v6.0.2, Cell Ranger v6.0.1, Cell Ranger v6.0.0, Cell Ranger v5.0.1, Cell Ranger v5.0.0, Cell Ranger v4.0.0, Cell Ranger v3.1.0, Cell Ranger v3.0.2, Cell Ranger v3.0.1, Cell Ranger v3.0.0, Space Ranger 3.1.2, Space Ranger 3.1.1, Space Ranger 3.1.0, Space Ranger 3.0.1, Space Ranger 3.0.0, demuxlet

Description: A unique or established human-readable name assigned to the panel of targets profiled in the experiment. For example, the panel of antibodies and corresponding fluorophores used in a flow cytometry experiment or panel used in a Xenium spatial transcriptomics experiment.

In most cases an accompanying metadata file should be provided that details information about the targets profiled in the experiment. This attribute links experimental data files to the target panel metadata via the synapse ID of that file.
The source of the nucleic acid used as input for sequencing library fragments. Select all that apply, though in most cases only a single label is expected.
Valid Values: poly(A) RNA, rRNA-depleted RNA, gDNA, surface protein feature barcode, intracellular protein feature barcode, antigen capture barcode, multiplexing oligo, BCR mRNA, TCR mRNA, Tn5-accessible gDNA, globin-depleted RNA, CRISPR protospacer feature barcode

Description: Biospecimen status before sample is processed into a scRNA-seq library. Several scRNA-seq technologies support a variety of sample processing methods which can introduces sources of technical variation.
Valid Values: nuclei suspension, cell suspension, fresh tissue, frozen tissue, FFPE tissue, flow-sorted cells, PFA-fixed tissue

Description: 10x Genomics Cell Ranger software output several different counts results and formats, some with different processing applied. This label distinguishes between these types and is particularly helpful when multiple files are uploaded with the sample name, e.g., barcodes.tsv.gz
Valid Values: raw feature bcmatrix, filtered feature bc matrix, molecule info

Description: The genomic/transcriptomic reference used for performing read alignment against.
Valid Values: 10x Cell Ranger Human GRCh38 2024-A, 10x Cell Ranger Human GRCh38 2020-A

Description: Sequencing library preparation method or kit used to create the library. If no commercially available kit was used, please select 'in-house library prep'.
Valid Values: NEBNext Ultra II Directional RNA Library, QIAseq miRNA Library, SMART-Seq v4 Ultra Low Input RNA, Nextera XT, SMARTer Stranded Total RNA v2, Nextera XT DNA, TruSeq Stranded mRNA, Chromium Single Cell Human TCR Amplification Kit, Chromium Single Cell Human BCR Amplification Kit, SMART-Seq Human BCR with UMI, SMART-Seq Human TCR with UMI, Takara Human BCR profiling for Illumina, Takara Human TCR profiling for Illumina, Takara Human TCRv2 profiling for Illumina, Takara Human scTCR profiling for Illumina, NEBNext Human Immune Sequencing Kit, 10x Chromium 3 GEX, 10x Chromium 3 GEX v3.1, 10x Chromium 5 GEX, 10x Universal 3 GEX, 10x Universal 5 GEX, 10x Chromium Flex, CEL-Seq2, Chromium scATAC Kit v2, in-house library prep, Chromium Next GEM Chip G

Description: High-level classification of dataset entity distinguishing between datasets compiled for a specific publication or as a general data resource.
Valid Values: experimental, publication

Description: A Dataset-specific attribute specifying the path to the wiki subpage within the ARK Portal - backend project that contains the acknowledgement statement that must be included in publications using data from the given dataset as a stipulation of the conditions of use.
A Dataset-specific attribute specifying the synID of the folder that contains a wiki write-up of the dataset description. This wiki content will be surfaced on the ARK Portal frontend site.
A Dataset-specific attribute specifying the ARK Portal release in which this dataset was first made available to the public.
Rds files store R objects, one per file. This label details the class of the R object saved to the Rds file or other similar file types.
Valid Values: list, vector, sparse matrix, Seurat object, data.frame, matrix, SummarizedExperiment

Description: NIH policy requires large-scale human genomics studies to be registered in dbGap. This is a Dataset-specific attribute indicating the unique identifier (i.e., accession) of the corresponding study that is registered in dbGap.
A high-level classifier indicating the disease status of an individual.
Valid Values: control, SLE, RA, At-Risk-RA, vitiligo, dermatomyositis, PsO, PsA, scleroderma, SjD

Description: A library label or name, unique within an experiment, used to distinguish sequencing libraries.

A label or identifier that is unique within a given experiment or dataset used to group data related to sample processing, sample pooling, or data collection batches. These batches often introduce technical effects that can be important to account for in downstream analyses.
A URL to the GitHub repository where associated code is available
Functional Model of Anatomy ontology ID corresponding to the anatomical site and origin of the biospecimen. This is a conditionally dependent attribute triggered by a subset of `biospecimenType`.
BRENDA Tissue and Enzyme Source Ontology ID (BTO) corresponding to the `biospecimenType`. This attribute is set by ARK Portal data managers.
Disease manifestation status of skin biospecimen.
Valid Values: lesional, lesional proximal, unaffected contralateral, unaffected

Description: Is a valid value of `biospecimenType` that triggers conditional dependencies for additional attributes.
Is a valid value of `biospecimenType` that triggers conditional dependencies for additional attributes.
Is a valid value of `biospecimenType` that triggers conditional dependencies for additional attributes.
Is a valid value of `biospecimenType` that triggers conditional dependencies for additional attributes.
Classification of saliva collection procedure. This is a conditionally dependent attribute triggered for saliva `biospecimenType`.
Valid Values: stimulated, unstimulated

Description: Is a valid value of `biospecimenType` that triggers conditional dependencies for additional attributes.
Classification of procedure for synovial tissue collection.
Valid Values: biopsy, arthroplasty, synovectomy

Description: Is a valid value of `biospecimenType` that triggers conditional dependencies for additional attributes.
Is a valid value of `biospecimenType` that triggers conditional dependencies for additional attributes.
General classification of publication.
Valid Values: pre-print, peer-reviewed, correction

Description: Title of the publication.
Journal in which the publication was released
Year (YYYY) in which the paper was published.
The publication date extracted from PubMed database
PubMedÂ® Identifier
Digital object identifier
Functional Model of Anatomy ontology label corresponding to the FMAID of the biospecimen collection site. This attribute is set by ARK Portal data managers.
General type classification of vitiligo disease manifestation.
Valid Values: segmental, non-segmental, mixed, unclassified

Description: Subtype classification of vitiligo disease manifestation.
Valid Values: focal, mucosal, acrofacial, generalized, universal, unisegmental, bisegmental

Description: A valid value of `diagnosis` that triggers conditional dependencies for additional attributes.
Age at which subject was diagnosed with `diagnosis`. If providing this value be sure the unit matches that used for `age`.
Age at which subject was enrolled in study or age at corresponding visit and data collection event.
The unit of measure used for `ageEnrollment` and `ageDiagnosis`
Valid Values: years, months

Description: A textual description of a person's sex at birth.
Valid Values: female, male, intersex, unknown

Description: Standing height of subject.
A textual description of a person's race.
Valid Values: asian, black or African American, white, hispanic, American indian or Alaska native, mixed race, native Hawaiian or other pacific islander, other, unknown

Description: The ethnicity of a person.
Valid Values: hispanic or latino, not hispanic or latino, unknown

Description: Unit of measure of value provided for `height`.
Valid Values: inches, centimeters, meters, feet

Description: Weight of subject.
Abbreviated unit of measure of value provided for `weight`.
Valid Values: lb, kg, g, oz

Description: Any diseases or medical condition that is simultaneously present in addition to `diagnosis`.
Valid Values: diabetes, cardiovascular disease, pulmonary disease, autoimmune thyroid disease, inflammatory bowel disease, psoriasis, multiple sclerosis, systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis, other

Description: Type of diabetes mellitus.
Valid Values: type 1, type 2, unknown, gestational

Description: A valid value of `comorbidities` that triggers conditional dependencies for additional attributes.
Vitiligo Disease Activity Score, a six-point scale that evaluates the activity of vitiligo
Total body Vitiligo Area Severity Index, a measure of the percentage of vitiligo involvement across the body calculated in terms of hand units.
Vitiligo Extent Tensity Index measures the extent of vitiligo by a numerical score and combines analysis of extensity and severity of vitiligo to produce a constant and reproducible number.
Psoriasis Area and Severity Index, is a measurement of the discoloration, thickness, scaling, and coverage of psoriasis plaques.
Cutaneous Dermatomyositis Disease Area and Severity Index, is a measurement used to characterize cutaneous dermatomyositis severity.
